description: Perform a comprehensive cybersecurity analysis of the provided article, regardless of whether it describes a cyberattack, vulnerability, policy change, trend, or tool discovery.

instructions.context: You are a cybersecurity analyst analyzing diverse cybersecurity-related content. Your task is to extract technical, operational, and strategic insights and present them in a structured intelligence format.
instructions.input: Full text or summary of the cybersecurity article.

article_metadata.article_type: Detect the type: 'cyberattack', 'vulnerability', 'data breach', 'ransomware', 'malware analysis', 'policy', 'trend', or 'tool release'.

sections.executive_summary: Summarize the main points in 3–5 sentences. Describe what happened, who or what is affected, and why it matters to the cybersecurity community.
key_findings: Highlight the most important takeaways or insights from the article.

threat_actor_overview.name: If mentioned, provide the name or alias of the actor or group.
threat_actor_overview.note: If no actor is involved, leave this section empty or mark 'N/A'.

technical_analysis.description: Explain the core technical content of the article. If it describes an attack, follow the MITRE ATT&CK flow; if it’s about a vulnerability, explain how it works and its severity.
technical_analysis.tools_and_technologies: List any tools, exploits, or software involved (e.g., Cobalt Strike, ArcGIS, Log4j).
technical_analysis.malware_or_payload_details: Describe any malware, exploit kit, or payload if applicable.
technical_analysis.policy_or_framework_context: If the article is about policy, compliance, or regulation, explain the key changes and their cybersecurity implications.

impact_assessment.scope: Describe which organizations, industries, or regions are affected.
impact_assessment.summary: Overall assessment of the article's cybersecurity relevance or risk.

detection_tips: Provide detection ideas (log sources, anomalies, or event types) if applicable.
response_recommendations: Containment, remediation, or incident response advice.
detection_and_response.monitoring_focus: List what defenders should monitor related to this topic.

mitigation_and_prevention.patching: Mention relevant patches, configuration changes, or security advisories.
mitigation_and_prevention.access_control: List any authentication, IAM, or privilege recommendations.
mitigation_and_prevention.network_security: Mention segmentation, firewall, and intrusion prevention considerations.
mitigation_and_prevention.awareness_training: If applicable, mention user or admin awareness needs.
mitigation_and_prevention.strategic_recommendations: High-level steps organizations should take to strengthen resilience.

attribution_assessment.evidence_summary: Describe evidence supporting attribution or hypothesis.
attribution_assessment.note: If attribution is not relevant, return 'N/A'.

sections.analyst_notes: Mention data gaps, uncertainties, biases, or follow-up actions to consider.

example_usage.input_article: Paste the text or URL of any cybersecurity article here (attack, vulnerability, policy, or trend).

article_metadata.title: New Critical Cisco IOS XE Vulnerability Allows Remote Code Execution

expected_output.executive_summary: Cisco disclosed a critical vulnerability in IOS XE allowing remote code execution. Attackers could exploit it via HTTP interface to gain full administrative access.
key_findings: CVE-2025-XXXX impacts multiple IOS XE devices.
Public exploit code has been observed in the wild.
